div.p: With over a century and a half of academic history, we continue to educate today's young minds.
The California Assessment of Student Performance and Progress is the state testing that happens every year, in schools throughout California.
Positively impacting the lives of all children and families.

div.strong: New Letter from Superintendent Gudalewicz (Updated April 9, 2020):

div.div: Please see the links below for a new letter from Superintendent Gudalewicz regarding distance learning, a suggested daily schedule for distance learning and RAFT learning activity sheets.
RAFT: https://raft.net/steam-learning-activity-sheets/

div.h3: Transition to Distance Learning for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year (Updated April 2, 2020)
div.div: Please see the attached letters from Santa Clara County Office of Education (SCCOE) regarding the transition to distance learning for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Orchard will continue to provide paper instructional materials as well as online learning options.
A new family resource, a suggested daily schedule with web links, is listed below to help support families with a daily distance learning schedule.

div.h3: Information Regarding School Closures (updated March 25, 2020)Go To Top of Page

h4.strong: Worksheets For Orchard Bruins Students During School Closure:

div.div: Interested in knowing what the content standards are for your child's grade level? For more information, visit CDE's webpage at https://www.cde.ca.gov/be/st/ss
Below are additional worksheets for students to work on during the school closure:

h3.strong: California Students - Access Educational Content from Home:

div.div: Free learning content from Britannica, ProQuest and TeachingBooks.
Access ID: orchard
Passcode: osd

h3.strong: Information For Parents Impacted by School Closures Due to COVID-19:

li.div: You may be eligible for unemployment benefits. Please click the link to view for more information:

li.div: Orchard School District closed until April 6th. Click here to view the notice of closure.

div.span: How to help your children stay safe:

li.a: Click here to view in English
Click here to view in Spanish
Click here to view in Vietnamese

li.div: Meals will be served at Orchard School parking lot from 11:30-12:30 for pickup of free meals for children preschool through 18 years old on the following dates:
Orchard families can continue to go to Santa Clara County Office of Education (SCCOE) located at1290 Ridder Park Drive in San Jose, CA on Thursdays and Fridays from 11:30 a.m. -1:30 p.m.

div.div: Starting in the 2019-20 school year, anew meal application must be filled out every year.
Orchard School has a new online payment system TITAN: https://family.titank12.com/

div.em: For more information, please visit the Cafeteria web page here.

div.div: Please revisit the Schedule/Next Steps for updates or contact your City Council Member for more information. The City of San Jose wants to build a freeway overpass that will drop down onto Silkwood Lane next to Orchard School from the other side of I-880. See the Project Limits and Sections.
More information can be found on our PTA site.

div.h3: Local Control & Acountability Plan (LCAP)Go To Top of Page

div.div: Consistent with California Education Code Section 52065, school districts must post prominently on the home page, the Local Control & Accountability Plan (LCAP).
Click here to view the LCAP.

figcaption.p: Find important dates, minimum days, and more here.
Get the latest parent information here!
Orchard works with staff, parents, and the community to provide students with instructional materials that reflect current educational practices.
Find out all you need to know about the different programs Orchard offers.
Get the contact information for all Orchards staff.
The Orchard School District’s Board of Trustees is comprised of five elected school board members who develop and set policies for the district.
